Interpreter Class Reference

#include <Interpreter.h>

Inheritance diagram for Interpreter:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Provides an interface to an object that can interpret lSystems The interpretation is a string (which will most likely need further interpretation) The interpretation of a particular interpreter can be controlled by a set of attributes.

For example, in the generic interpreter, the attributes UpAngle, DownAngle, etc. control the angle that a particular element in the lsystem will cause the system to turn.

virtual bool Interpreter::getCopy (  Interpreter *&  interpreter,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
)  [pure virtual]
 

Creates a copy of the current interpreter.

Note that if you pass it a non-null pointer, it will attempt to delete it, if it doesn't point at allocated memory, this will make it seg fault. (This is to encourage you to allocate and/or intitialize your pointers to NULL

Parameters:
interpreter a pointer at a copy of this lSystem (the memory is allocated in this method)

Implemented in LSystemGenericInterpreter.

virtual bool Interpreter::getSystem (  string &  interpretedSystem,
System &  system,
unsigned int  start,
unsigned int  finish,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
)  [pure virtual]
 

Retrieves the interpretation of the lsystem.

The second version is ok for now, since the System interface requires getSystem to return a string version of the object.

Parameters:
system the system you wish to have interpreted (as an object or in string form)
start the start index where you wish to began interpretation
finish the end index where you wish to end intepretation - if finish <= start, then the interpretation runs to the end of the system. Also, note that the interpreter is free to stop any point before finish.

Implemented in LSystemGenericInterpreter.
